fields.name: Request package inclusion
fields.content:
This form is meant for registration of golang projects whose package name does not start with "golang-" prefix, i.e. docker, kubernetes, runc. etc. Normally, automatic scans are run periodically on registered golang packages. Scans are designed to discover API backward incompatibilities, to create a dependency graph of golang projects packages and to collect other information that can be used to detect various issues which does not make the golang ecosystem healthy enough. If you register your project, you can benefit from the scans and be informed about updates of your project's dependencies (API breakages, new symbols, depricated packages, etc.) or about changes and recommended updates in your spec files.
To register your project please fill in your email, project's homepage (github.com, bitbucket.org, ...) and package name. In "Review request text" field you can provide additional information about the package (regular changes in API, active upstream, under development, etc.) or ask questions about scans. Your input and feedback is welcomed.

fields.name: Review spec file
fields.content: If you are not sure whether your spec file contains all necessary data, macros or if there is something else you can extend your spec file with, don't hesitate to contact us. We will try to provide you a feedback and help with advanced features (i.e. support for secondary architectures, CI/unit-test testing, macros for automatic updates, etc.). To get a help from us, please fill the form.

fields.name: Documentation
fields.content:
Welcome to gofed-web documentation. Here you can find all necessary information how to use this web. The best way how to use all the features offered by this web, use gofed client.

REST Service

It is possible to use simple REST service in order to retrieve data from the server. REST service is available under the /rest/ adress (http://209.132.179.123/rest/). There are implemented three basic filtering options:

  • Date-based filtering
  • Depth-based filtering
  • Commit-based filtering

Each filter is documented in one of the following sections.

Date based filtering

List API changes in commits of a project project_id, query based on date. 
/rest/date/<project_id>/<from_date>/<to_date>/
  • <project_id> - project full name
  • <from_date> - date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD) describing lower bound of the query
  • <to_date> - date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD) describing upper bound of the query, if omitted current date is used
Example
/rest/date/cadvisor/2015-08-30/2015-08-27/

Depth based filtering

List API changes in commits of a project project_id, depth based querying. 
/rest/depth/<project_id>/<depth>/<from_commit>/
  • <project_id> - project full name
  • <depth> - depth of a query
  • <from_commit> - use commit from_commit to describe starting commit; if omitted, the latest commit is used
Example
/rest/depth/cadvisor/10/499737d/

Commit based filtering

List API changes in commits of a project project_id, query based on commits. 
/rest/commit/<project_id>/<from_commit>/<to_commit>/
  • <project_id> - project full name
  • <from_commit> - ending commit (hash)
  • <to_commit> - starting commit (hash); if omitted, the latest commit is used
Example
/rest/commit/cadvisor/abd5386/4445152/

Dependencies Check

Check wether provided commit is older/same/newer then in Fedora package. 
/rest/check-deps/<project_id>/<your_commit>/
  • <project_id> - project full name
  • <your_commit> - commit you want to compare
Example
/rest/check-deps/cadvisor/499737d/

Graph Plotting Service

You can visualize results in an SVG graph. Graph service is available under /graph/ (http://209.132.179.123/graph/) and syntax is same as for REST service. The only addition is a graph type (total, added, modified and cpc - changes per commit).

Query Graphs

/graph/<graph_type>/date/<project_id>/<from_date>/<to_date>/graph.svg
Example
  • /graph/total/date/cadvisor/2015-08-30/2015-08-27/graph.svg
  • /graph/added/date/cadvisor/2015-08-30/2015-08-27/graph.svg
  • /graph/modified/date/cadvisor/2015-08-30/2015-08-27/graph.svg
  • /graph/modified/date/cadvisor/2015-08-30/2015-08-27/graph.svg
/graph/<graph_type>/depth/<project_id>/<depth>/<from_commit>/graph.svg
Example
  • /rest/depth/cadvisor/10/499737d/graph.svg
  • /rest/depth/cadvisor/10/499737d/graph.svg
  • /rest/depth/cadvisor/10/499737d/graph.svg
  • /rest/depth/cadvisor/10/499737d/graph.svg
/graph/<graph_type>/commit/<project_id>/<from_commit>/<to_commit>/graph.svg
Example
  • /graph/total/commit/cadvisor/abd5386/4445152/graph.svg
  • /graph/total/commit/cadvisor/abd5386/4445152/graph.svg
  • /graph/total/commit/cadvisor/abd5386/4445152/graph.svg
  • /graph/total/commit/cadvisor/abd5386/4445152/graph.svg

Dependency Graphs

/graph/dependency/<project_id>/graph.png
Example
/graph/dependency/cadvisor/graph.png

fields.name: About
fields.content:
This web was designed to centralize golang packaging effort and provide useful statistics for golang developers and package maintainers. It uses gofed tool in order to analyze and summarize statistics. Source codes of gofed-web and gofed are available on github.com.

Main point of contacts and credits go to:
  • Jan Chaloupka - mainly gofed
  • Fridolín Pokorný - mainly gofed-web and gofed client
If you have some questions or suggestions, do not hesitate to contact us (we don't bite... usually :-) ).

gofed-web - centralizing golang packaging
